page.title: 12Education in Alderney I
page.content: Alderney has only one school for ages 5-16 years.It must be one of the very few all-age schools in the United Kingdom.The infant department has 54 pupils, junior 71 and senior 77 making a total of 202. There are 15 teachers employed in the school; a part-time grounds man, a care_taker and several cleaners. The school has 11 classrooms, a hall/gymnasium, a science laboratory, a woodwork/metal work shop, a domestic science room and a centre for children with special needs. Outside there is a football field, a swimming pool, two netball courts and an infants playground. The education system still retains selection at 11 years old as embodied in the 11+ exam.Pupils successful in this exam are offered a place at one of the schools in Guernsey.This means the children board out in Guernsey.
